# porkbun_glue_record (Resource)

Manage glue records (nameserver IP addresses) for your domain.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "porkbun_glue_record" "ns1" {
  domain    = "example.com"
  subdomain = "ns1"
  ips = [
    "192.0.2.1",
    "2001:db8::1"
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `domain` (String) The FQDN of the domain.
- `ips` (Set of String) The IP addresses for the glue record.
- `subdomain` (String) The subdomain of the glue record (e.g., 'ns1').

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of the glue record (format: domain:subdomain).

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
terraform import porkbun_glue_record.example example.com:ns1
```
